intro: Mikania perhirta, commonly known as the arrowleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks. It produces showy blue or purple flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Mikania perhirta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
